name: Novotel Paris CDG Terminal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right on terminal 3, convenient location, quiet but wifi was not working at the time we stayed. Was told that it is under repair.
reviews.title: Very Convenient

reviews.text: Coffee and tea provided in room. Clean but carpets were showing sign of age.
reviews.title: Unfriendly end to a wonderful trip
Serves Its "In Transit" Purpose
reviews.text: Vanity sink was draining slow ,reception gladly offered to change our room.
Restaurant on site . Breakfast is not included .
reviews.title: Perfect for an early flight

reviews.text: We stayed this hotel for a night on our way to Zurich, Swiss. The room size was enough for 2 adults and a 1yr old toddler and was clean. The sofa bed was a nice add-on in case you need extra bedding space. Connection to Terminal 1 was very convenient as hotel's back door directly connects to CDGVAL (free airport train-tram to and from terminal 1 & 2) that runs every 5min or so. All people were courteous and friendly.
reviews.title: Clean & Efficient

reviews.text: My only complaints were... First there is no person that would help you with luggage. So you might end up multiple trips to lobby to upload all you luggages by yourself. Look for the carts when you get off the CDGVAL. Although Hotel elevator can only accommodate 1 cart at a time, it would definitely reduce the number of trips between lobby and your room.
reviews.title: Shabby and expensive - be aware!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second there are no tubs. Okay this is matter of preference, but for family traveling with toddler who is not yet able to use showers should be prepared to get NO for an answer. I have seen travelers' photo that show tub in the bathroom; however when I request a room change for bathtub due our child, the reception said "There is no room with tub in this hotel". I did not argue about the picture that I saw from this site nor did I clarified definition of "No Room" - No bathtub at all or All occupied? However they were able to provide plastic infant tub that was little bigger than the average size sold in the states.
reviews.title: Affordable & Easy Airport Acess

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bottom line this hotel was clean, efficient, and affordable for people who is transferring through CDG, and I would stay this hotel again despite some lacking things that I mentioned above.
reviews.title: Novotel CDG Terminal Paris
Location is the only thing good about this hotel
reviews.text: We stayed in 2 so called executive rooms, air condition was broken and not fixed, radio/iPod dock dead, water in sink did not go down. Did complain and was not charged for 2 adult breakfasts as a compensation at checkout. Rooms are old and shabby, lobby is OK, definitely not worth EUR260/room/night.

My travelling partner and I arrived in Paris at 10.30pm following a train ride from Montpellier. We were due at CDG's Terminal 2 at 5am the following morning. This could have proved pretty exhausting but this hotel was perfect! Check in was easy and the reception staff were fabulously friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and well equipped. My only gripe is that the restaurant closes at 11pm - would be great if the hotel had a sandwich counter or similar for travellers checking in late...
reviews.title: Covenient and Good Value for Money

reviews.text: Travelled on way to disney(rather than early start with uk airport hotel, we went for late flight with paris hotel) 6mth old and 3 yr old.
reviews.title: Beware with double buggies
Convenient!
reviews.text: Warning on buggies isn't hotels fault, the cdgval train has barriers stopping airport trolleys - hence double buggies too, I carried buggy over but a bit tricky with luggage/kids etc.
Hotel has artex walls, separate toilet/bathroom mixed with some modernisation so felt a bit weird. Four of us fit in the room fine.
reviews.title: OK for an airport stay

reviews.text: Breakfast was good /not excellent(much better than disney). They had computer games in the lobby , I think Xboxes with football, that would be good for older kids. Overall the cdgval experience vs our good taxi transfer means we are unlikely to do this hotel and will probably go back to a uk airport hotel and early flight.
reviews.title: Disappointing

aka: Novotel Paris Cdg Terminal Hotel Roissy
description: Situé au coeur de l'Aéroport de Roissy Charles de Gaulle, à 30mn de Paris. Novotel Paris CDG Terminal vous accueille à l'occasion d'un voyage d'affaires, d'une visite au Parc des Expositions de Villepinte (10 mn en voiture ou 3mn en RER).Relié directement aux Terminaux 1 et 2 et à la gare TGV par le CDGVAL ( métro automatique 24h/24h) Accès à pied au Terminal 3.L' hôtel dispose de 201 chambres, 5 salles de réunion,un bar et un restaurant. Parking privé/payant à votre disposition. Les plus de l'hôtelNotre hôtel et nos équipes vivent au rythme de la clientèle d'aéroport, que ce soit pour un séjour en chambre en journée, possible de 8h à 20h, où pour un petit-déjeuner très matinal avec l'ouverture du Buffet dès 5h du matin.
